name: 1,2-bis(2-chloroethoxy)ethane
Reason: Starting with ethane as the basic unit, we consider the introduction of functional groups and their influence on the melting point. Ethane has a melting point of -183°C. Each -O- linkage generally increases the melting point due to the addition of potential hydrogen bonding and dipole-dipole interactions; we estimate this increase at about +50°C per ethoxy group. However, the chloroethyl side chains contribute to the molecular weight and polarizability, which also tend to raise the melting point; we might estimate this increase at around +30°C per chloroethyl. However, since the molecule also becomes larger and may disrupt packing efficiency, this might slightly mitigate the increase. Considering the molecule has two -O- linkages and two chloroethyl sides, the estimated total change would be (2 * 50°C) + (2 * 30°C) = 160°C. Therefore, the predicted melting point would be -183°C + 160°C = -23°C.
